arch.name: Optinal_Extenstions_for_Gnome
arch.description: Gnome Shell Extensions are small pieces of code written by third party developers that modify the way the GNOME desktop behaves. They are used to add new functionality or change the behavior of the desktop.

arch.name: Zsh_and_Oh_My_Zsh
arch.description: Zsh is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language. Oh My Zsh is an open-source, community-driven framework for managing your Zsh configuration.

arch.name: Tuxedo_Control_Center
arch.description: This package installs the Tuxedo Control Center, which is a graphical user interface for managing Tuxedo computers.

arch.name: Oh_My_Posh
arch.description: Oh My Posh is a prompt theme engine for any shell that supports prompt customization. It is designed to be easy to install and use, and it comes with a variety of themes to choose from.

values.name: Enable Oh My Posh
install_script: if [ -f /etc/bash.bashrc ]; then echo 'eval "$(oh-my-posh --init --shell bash --config $theme_location)"' | sudo tee -a /etc/bash.bashrc; fi
if [ -f /etc/zsh/zprofile ]; then echo 'eval "$(oh-my-posh --init --shell zsh --config $theme_location)"' | sudo tee -a /etc/zsh/zprofile; fi

arch.name: Nvidia_Open_Drivers
arch.description: Nvidia Open Drivers are open-source drivers for Nvidia graphics cards. They are designed to provide better performance and compatibility than the proprietary drivers.

values.name: Other Dependencies
values.install_value: gamemode lib32-gamemode lib32-gnutls lib32-vkd3d vkd3d lib32-vulkan-icd-loader vulkan-headers
values.check_value: gamemode lib32-gamemode lib32-gnutls lib32-vkd3d vkd3d lib32-vulkan-icd-loader vulkan-headers
values.remove_value: gamemode lib32-gamemode lib32-gnutls lib32-vkd3d vkd3d lib32-vulkan-icd-loader vulkan-headers

debian.name: VMware_Workstation
debian.description: VMware Workstation is a hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems; it enables users to set up virtual machines on a single physical machine and use them simultaneously along with the actual machine.

values.name: VMware Workstation Dependencies
values.install_value: linux-headers-$(uname -r) build-essential gcc make dkms git wget patch net-tools
values.check_value: linux-headers-$(uname -r) build-essential gcc make dkms git wget patch net-tools

values.name: VMware Workstation
remove_script: sudo systemctl stop vmware; sudo systemctl disable vmware;echo "yes" | sudo /usr/bin/vmware-installer --uninstall-product vmware-workstation

values.name: VirtualBox Repository
install_script: sudo apt install wget gnupg2 lsb-release -y

values.name: Docker Repository
install_script: echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/docker.asc] https://download.docker.com/linux/debian $(. /etc/os-release && echo "$VERSION_CODENAME") stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

values.name: Remove Old Docker Cli
values.install_value: docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc
values.check_value: docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc
values.remove_value: docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc

fedora.name: VMware_Workstation
fedora.description: VMware Workstation is a hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems; it enables users to set up virtual machines on a single physical machine and use them simultaneously along with the actual machine.

values.name: VMware Workstation Dependencies
values.install_value: kernel-devel kernel-headers gcc dkms make patch net-tools
values.check_value: kernel-devel kernel-headers gcc dkms make patch net-tools

values.name: VMware_Workstation
remove_script: sudo systemctl stop vmware; sudo systemctl disable vmware;echo "yes" | sudo /usr/bin/vmware-installer --uninstall-product vmware-workstation

fedora.name: VirtualBox-7.0
fedora.description: VirtualBox is a powerful x86 and AMD64/Intel64 virtualization product for enterprise as well as home use. Not only is VirtualBox an extremely feature rich, high performance product for enterprise customers, it is also the only professional solution that is freely available as Open Source Software under the terms of the GNU General Public License (GPL) version 2.

fedora.name: Qemu_and_VM_Manager
fedora.description: QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer. When used as a machine emulator, QEMU can run OSes and programs made for one machine (e.g. an ARM board) on a different machine (e.g. your own PC). When used as a virtualizer, QEMU achieves near native performance by executing the guest code directly on the host CPU.

fedora.name: Docker_CLI_and_Docker_Desktop
fedora.description: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels.

values.name: Remove Old Docker Cli
values.remove_value: docker  docker-client  docker-client-latest  docker-common  docker-latest docker-selinux docker-latest-logrotate  docker-logrotate  docker-engine-selinux  docker-engine

fedora.name: Podman_and_Podman_Desktop
fedora.description: Podman is a daemon less container engine for developing, managing, and running OCI Containers on your Linux System. Containers can either be run as root or in rootless mode. Simply put: `alias docker=podman`.

fedora.name: Visual_Studio_Code
fedora.description: Visual Studio Code is a source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. It includes support for debugging, embedded Git control, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring.

fedora.name: Github_Desktop
fedora.description: GitHub Desktop is a seamless way to contribute to projects on GitHub and GitHub Enterprise. GitHub Desktop is your springboard for work. Youll be able to clone repositories, create branches, commit changes, and push code straight from your desktop.

fedora.name: Steam
fedora.description: Steam is a video game digital distribution service by Valve. It was launched as a standalone software client in September 2003 as a way for Valve to provide automatic updates for their games, and expanded to include games from third-party publishers.

fedora.name: Discord
fedora.description: Discord is a proprietary freeware VoIP application and digital distribution platform designed for creating communities ranging from gamers to education and businesses.

fedora.name: Google_Chrome_Stable
fedora.description: Google Chrome is a cross-platform web browser developed by Google. It was first released in 2008 for Microsoft Windows, and was later ported to Linux, macOS, iOS, and Android.

fedora.name: Tuxedo
fedora.description: Tuxedo Computers is a German computer manufacturer that specializes in Linux laptops and desktops.

fedora.name: Optinal_Extenstions_for_Gnome
fedora.description: Gnome Shell Extensions are small pieces of code written by third party developers that modify the way the GNOME desktop behaves. They are used to add new functionality or change the behavior of the desktop.

fedora.name: Cloudflare_WARP
fedora.description: Cloudflare WARP is a free app that makes your Internet more private. It uses Cloudflares global network to secure your devices Internet connection.

fedora.name: Oh_My_Posh
fedora.description: Oh My Posh is a prompt theme engine for any shell. It's highly customizable and extensible.

values.name: Enable Oh My Posh
install_script: if [ -f /etc/bashrc ]; then echo 'eval "$(oh-my-posh --init --shell bash --config $theme_location)"' | sudo tee -a /etc/bashrc; fi
if [ -f /etc/zshrc ]; then echo 'eval "$(oh-my-posh --init --shell zsh --config $theme_location)"' | sudo tee -a /etc/zshrc; fi

fedora.name: Zsh_and_Oh_My_Zsh
fedora.description: Zsh is a shell designed for interactive use, although it is also a powerful scripting language. Oh My Zsh is an open-source, community-driven framework for managing your Zsh configuration.

fedora.name: Ani_Cli
fedora.description: Ani Cli is a command line tool to watch anime.

fedora.name: Gnome Configuration Tools
fedora.description: Gnome Configuration Tools are a set of tools to configure Gnome Desktop Environment.

fedora.name: Microsoft_Core_TTF_Fonts
fedora.description: Microsoft Core TTF Fonts are a set of TrueType fonts that were developed by Microsoft. These fonts are used in Microsoft products and are also used in many other applications.

fedora.name: Flutter
fedora.description: Flutter is Googles UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

ubuntu.description: VMware Workstation is a hosted hypervisor that runs on x64 versions of Windows and Linux operating systems; it enables users to set up virtual machines on a single physical machine and use them simultaneously along with the actual machine.
